conclusion: Analyze forces acting on each hemisphere and use equilibrium conditions.
Hemispheres A, B, and C are in contact with each other and the ground with radius R.
Centers of hemispheres A and B are separated by distance 2R.
A and B are not exerting any force on each other, analyze separately.
Forces on A: weight mg downward, normal force F upward, frictional force f horizontally.
Forces on B: weight 2mg downward, normal force upward, frictional force horizontally.
Forces on C: weight mg downward, normal force N from A and B at an angle.
C is in equilibrium, sum of forces in vertical and horizontal directions must be zero.
Vertical equilibrium: 2N cos(θ) = mg.
Horizontal equilibrium: N sin(θ) = f.
Angle θ determined by geometry of spheres, centers form equilateral triangle with side 2R.
Solve for N: 2N(√3/2) = mg, N = mg/√3.
Solve for f: f = N(1/2), f = mg/(2√3).
Normal force F on A must balance weight and horizontal component of normal force from C.
Simplify F: F = mg(1 + 1/(4√3)).
Frictional force f is mg/(2√3).
Magnitude of normal force F exerted by ground on A: F = mg(1 + 1/(4√3)).
Magnitude of frictional force f: f = mg/(2√3).
